title: Vanuatu hit with 6 . 2 magnitude earthquake
message:
Vanuatu has been hit with a 6.2 magnitude earthquake.
The earthquake struck about 95km from Luganville about 7.24pm (AEST) on Wednesday, according to Geoscience Australia.
Camera Icon A magnitude 6.2 earthquake hit Vanuatu on Wednesday night.
Geoscience Australia Credit: NCA NewsWireCamera Icon There’s no tsunami threat on the Australian coast.

title: Samoa Observer | Strong afternoon quake felt
message:
(Photo: Kitiona Utuva)The epicenter was located approximately 180.40 km south-west of Apia and Samoa was shook at 2:38PM.
(Photo: Kitiona Utuva)An earthquake with a magnitude of 6.0 on the Richter Scale shook Samoa on Thursday afternoon.
According to the Samoa Meteorology Office, its epicenter was located approximately 180.40 km south-west of Apia and happened at a depth 10 kilometres.
The Samoa Meteorology Office stated the earthquake occurred in the open waters of the Pacific Ocean.
The Samoa Meteorology Office will continue to monitor the situation and provide updates as necessary.

title: Jasper County recovering from storm damage , trees falling on roads
message:
Parts of Jasper County are still underwater and now trees are falling in the streets, posing a threat to safety for residents.
"They're just falling at random times and it's scary to have your kids outside without knowing where the trees are going to land," says White.
"Our precinct four commissioner Dennis Marsh, he actually sent an estimate last week of about 10 trees, 11 trees per mile in his precinct that he's finding on the county roads that are dead," says Precinct 1 Commissioner Seth Martindale.
The trees were then unable to withstand the flooding and high winds and began collapsing.
Among flooding and falling trees, some roads in Jasper County have also been compromised.

title: Home insurance premiums jump by 19 % in a year after severe winter weather
message:
The average home insurance premium jumped by 19% annually in the first quarter of 2024, according to figures from the Association of British Insurers (Peter Byrne/PA)Home insurance premiums have jumped by 19 percent or £60 annually in the first quarter of 2024, according to figures from the Association of British Insurers (ABI).
The association said that home insurance premiums rose by three percent in the first quarter of 2024, following a severe winter for weather damage.
The average home insurance (combined buildings and contents cover) premium paid rose to £375.
The thre percent quarterly rise is lower than a four percent quarterly increase recorded in the fourth quarter of 2023.
The ABI said that, when adjusted for inflation, prices still sit below peaks seen in the first quarter of 2016.

title: How the Weather Prediction Center creates charts , forecasts and outlooks for fronts , precipitation and more
message:
(KFYR) - Since weather forecasts can get rather complex, the Weather Prediction Center (WPC) creates products that communicate the impacts nationally while focusing on extreme weather events regionally.
The WPC also creates precipitation forecasts that combine many weather forecast models into one map that meteorologists adjust.
Winter Storm Severity Index (WPC)The Weather Prediction Center is at the foundation of communicating the nation’s weather story 24/7, helping fellow meteorologists and the public.

title: An elite club with past Indonesian presidents ? Why incoming leader Prabowo idea is stirring debate
message:
Media outlets were quick to pounce on the idea of a presidential club, first raised by Mr Prabowo’s spokesperson in late April.
Earlier this week, he said the presidential club would not be a formal set-up and there are no plans to institutionalise it, unlike the Presidential Advisory Council (Wantimpres).
By the time Mr Prabowo takes office on Oct 20, Indonesia will have three living former presidents: Mr Joko Widodo, Mr Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono and Ms Megawati Soekarnoputri.
The United States has such a club, Mr Andi noted.
It is widely believed that Ms Megawati viewed this as a betrayal.

title: Buncombe County residents left picking up the pieces from severe hail storm
message:
Wednesday afternoon’s hail storm left many locals in fear of what Wednesday night's storm could do next to their property.
Over in Buncombe County, just outside of Barnardsville, Vanessa Ankney faces the daunting task of picking up what’s left of her chicken coop.
Ankney showed News 13 just how much destruction the hail storm left behind.
News 13 also spoke with Sherry Hardwood, who works at Triangle Stop.
Triangle stop is located just about four miles away from Ankney and she says she’s still in disbelief.

title: Too many trees creating unhealth forest in northern Arizona
message:
FLAGSTAFF, AZ (AZFamily) — Wildfires in Coconino County have cost local communities homes, hundreds of millions of dollars, and an entire mountainside worth of forest.
Jay Smith, Coconino County forest restoration director, said while the forest looks lush and green, that’s not exactly what they want.
However, Smith said the trees that make up these forests are also what’s choking it out.
However, Coconino County is now fighting the next major wildfire before it happens.
Once this work is done, they’ll bring back fire, which has kept this forest healthy for millions of years.

title: Waco three - day watering limits to take effect in July
message:
Waco water users starting in July will only be allowed to use sprinklers three days per week under an updated drought contingency plan the Waco City Council approved Tuesday.
Along with the updated drought contingency plan, the council approved a new long-term water conservation plan, almost two months after the plans were introduced to the council.
In addition to the new drought plan, city staff also showcased a water conservation plan prepared by engineering consulting firm CDM Smith designed to preserve Waco’s water resources for the next century.
WateringThe biggest change to Waco’s drought plan is a permanent three-day-per-week watering schedule.
Drought stagesUnder the new plan, the triggers for drought stage levels have been altered and will kick in sooner compared to the old plan.

title: Marion County residents learn how to spot severe storms , thanks to NWS meteorologist
message:
OCALA, Fla. (WCJB) - With less than a month before hurricane season, meteorologists at the National Weather Service in Jacksonville stopped in Marion County, teaching residents how severe storms develop.
The SKYWARN Spotter Class was held at the Marion County Sheriff’s Office Emergency Operations Center Wednesday night.
Meteorologist Kip Bricker led the presentation, teaching residents the difference between severe weather watches and warnings, how thunderstorms develop, and how to monitor severe storms, amongst other topics.
Another session is scheduled at the Alachua County Emergency Operations Center on May 28.
RELATED: 660 loads of debris hauled off to landfill during tornado clean-up, more still to clean“This new radar will actually help the National Weather Service help in predicting or seeing rotations for tornadoes and severe weather coming into Marion County,” said Bowlin.

message:
NASHVILLE, Tenn. (WSMV) - A severe weather outbreak impacted many communities across Middle Tennessee & Southern Kentucky on Wednesday.
Early in the morning on May 8, the Storm Prediction Center increased our threat for severe weather to a level 4 out of 5.
Even tornado warnings were issued for many areas, and large hail caused damage in many communities.
Supercells were showing rotation and multiple tornado warnings and large hail were the result.
Damaging winds, large hail, flooding, and tornadoes all remain possible.

title: Preparing for more storms across eastern Kentucky
message:
BOYD COUNTY, Ky. (WSAZ) - It’s the calm before the storm with emergency management crews on standby, as another round of storms are expected to pick up later Wednesday evening.
“Be prepared before you go to bed and have multiple ways to receive those warnings,” said Tim England, Boyd County Emergency Management Director.
England says a helpful tip is making sure you have everything you need before you go to bed when it comes to night-time storms.
For example, having a flashlight on hand, plus your phone and portable charger handy.
England says the potential for flooding from streams and creeks is at the forefront.

title: Kent to request $20M in federal grant to address flooding at Mill Creek
message:
Kent School District and the City of Kent are working together on a federal grant request to address decades of flooding from Mill Creek.
"Mill Creek students, staff and community members expect flooding on a regular basis every year."
On May 7, Kent City Council approved a plan to dredge the creek this summer, removing years of silt and sediment.
So, we’re dealing with the creek, we’re dealing with the salmon-bearing creek, storm water retention.

title: Community is  part of the equation  when it comes to wildfire prevention
message:
Firefighters and partner agencies from across California gathered Wednesday in Paso Robles to discuss their commitment to preventing wildfires as part of Wildfire Preparedness Week.
During the gathering, some speakers focused on the public's role in wildfire prevention.
“It's paying attention to your surroundings, paying attention to what you're doing when you're doing it,” Owens said.
Owens added that many wildfires begin as vehicle or vegetation fires.
A lack of awareness surrounding your vehicle or property could allow a fire to start.

title: Stuart Anderson launches campaign to hear flooding experiences
message:
Parliamentary candidate Stuart Anderson is launching a survey to hear about how flooding affects residents and what can be done to support them.
Parliamentary candidate Stuart AndersonEvery year flooding puts 5.7 million homes and businesses in England at risk.
In October, Storm Babet flooded 109 properties internally and 28 businesses, and in January, Storm Henk flooded 74 properties and 32 businesses.

title: Storm Chaser Rescues Texas Family After Home Is Hit by a Tornado
message:
One family outside of Abilene is certainly grateful for Storm Chaser Freddy McKinney.
As the harrowing video aired live on YouTube, viewers watched on as McKinney rescued the family and their dog.
Storm Chaser Freddy McKinney, who regularly goes live on YouTube while searching for severe weather, quite possibly saved this family from a much worse fate.
McKinney was able to rescue the young family and get them to the nearest hospital.

title: Climate of fear : How climate crisis and biodiversity loss pose massive threats to national security
message:
The climate crisis and biodiversity loss are two of the biggest national security threats facing Ireland today, according to multiple official reports.
(Image: XRI)But the horrific scenes playing out across the country around rising immigration were also pinpointed as a risk by government in its 2023 National Risk Assessment.
Climate is a 'threat multiplier'DCU Centre for Climate & Society chair, associate professor Diarmuid Torney, says: “Climate change is a threat multiplier.
The national security risk from climate and biodiversity might not be as visible to us.... but are certainly there.
The Climate Change Advisory Council also advises how Ireland can make the transition to a climate resilient, biodiversity rich, environmental sustainable and climate neutral future.

title: Wicken Fen project faces  challenging timescales
message:
At least 70,000 people visit Wicken Fen visitors annually, with the trust hoping many more will take part in the reserve's celebrations marking 125 years [National Trust/Mike Selby]The National Trust says it is facing "challenging timescales" to complete an “essential” new £1.8m project.
The conservation charity has received funding from the government for a peatland restoration project at Wicken Fen nature reserve in Cambridgeshire.
The National Trust plans to restore 531 acres (215ha) of peat - a vital carbon store - at the site to retain rainwater and manage water tables to create saturated, healthy peat.
The charity acquired two acres (0.8ha) of land at Wicken Fen in 1899 and it now extends across more than 2,000 acres (830ha).
Nearly 9,500 species have been recorded at Wicken Fen, including 2,072 species of flies, 1,775 species of beetles and 1,252 species of moths.

title: State , federal & local leaders meet for annual Montana wildfire season briefing
message:
HELENA — Despite a strong storm that brought snow to Helena Wednesday, Montana’s wildfire season isn’t far away.
State, federal and local administrators met in Helena to talk about their preparations, in Gov.
Leaders met at the Montana Department of Natural Resources and Conservation’s fire aviation support hangar at the Helena Regional Airport.
Leaders said it’s still early to know what kind of fire season Montana could see this year, but they’re prepared.
“I say that with some confidence, in that, whatever this fire season brings, know that your counties are ready.

message:
Severe Weather Team 2 is tracking another round of storms over north Georgia Thursday morning with the risk for embedded strong to severe storms.
Severe Weather Team 2 Chief Meteorologist Brad Nitz tracked multiple tornado warnings and severe thunderstorm warnings throughout the night.

title: What is the Main Development Region ( MDR ) of the North Atlantic Ocean ?
message:
The Main Development Region of the Atlantic Ocean runs from Africa to the Caribbean Islands and is an area where the majority of tropical cyclones form.
The area is annually home to some of the warmest water, allowing tropical cyclones to develop quickly during the heart of the hurricane season.
Climatologists estimate that 85% of major hurricanes and 60% of all other tropical cyclones form in either the Caribbean or the Atlantic MDR.
During the modern satellite era, tropical cyclone seasons in 1968, 1977, 1982, 1991, 1993 and 2003 produced minimal or no activity in the MDR.
Original article source: What is the Main Development Region (MDR) of the North Atlantic Ocean?
